title: 107_hr898
content: The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2001" may cover marriage and family therapist services under Part B. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2001" expands coverage under Part B to include marriage and family therapist services. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2001" expands Part B coverage to include marriage and family therapist services. Additionally, Public Law 106-554 is amended to add a new subsection. "Marriage and Family Therapist Services are now covered under the "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2001." Public Law 106-554 has been amended to include this new coverage." The term 'marriage and family therapist services' refers to services provided by a therapist for diagnosing and treating mental illnesses, authorized by state law. A 'marriage and family therapist' is an individual with a master's or doctoral degree and relevant licensure. The text discusses the requirements for marriage and family therapists to be eligible for payment under Medicare Part B, including obtaining a degree, completing supervised clinical experience, and being licensed or certified in the state they practice. Additionally, it mentions the amendment of payment clauses and the amount of payment for marriage and family therapist services under Medicare. The text discusses amendments to Medicare payment clauses for marriage and family therapist services, including the exclusion from the Skilled Nursing Facility Prospective Payment System and inclusion as practitioners for assignment of claims. Amendment to Medicare payment clauses includes marriage and family therapists as practitioners for assignment of claims. The amendment to the Social Security Act includes marriage and family therapists in rural health clinics and hospice programs, allowing them to provide services previously limited to clinical psychologists and social workers. Additionally, marriage and family therapists are now authorized to develop discharge plans for post-hospital services. The effective date of these changes is specified in the act. The amendments made by this Act apply to services furnished on or after January 1, 2002.
